intro: Atalanthus webbii, commonly known as the Webb's leafcup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes sedges and buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Atalanthus webbii is adapted to withstand drought and has a short growing season.
